remarks: "Camestros", one of the syllogisms of Aristotelian logic.  All ` ph ` is ` ps ` , no ` ch ` is ` ps ` , and ` ch ` exist, therefore some ` ch ` is not ` ph ` .  (In Aristotelian notation, AEO-2:  PaM and SeM therefore SoP.) For example, "All horses have hooves", "No humans have hooves", and humans exist, therefore "Some humans are not horses". (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 28-Aug-2016.)  (Revised by David A. Wheeler, 2-Sep-2016.)
statement:
camestros.maj $e |- A. x ( ph -> ps ) $.
camestros.min $e |- A. x ( ch -> -. ps ) $.
camestros.e $e |- E. x ch $.
camestros $p |- E. x ( ch /\ -. ph ) $.
